intro: Trichanthecium machrisianum, commonly known as the Malabar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its roots contain milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Trichanthecium machrisianum is often found in forest understories and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
